text: Claude Clegg (full name: Claude Andrew Clegg III) is a historian who specializes in the history of the African diaspora in the Americas. He is currently the Lyle V. Jones Distinguished Professor at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, with a joint appointment in African, African American, and Diaspora Studies. ==Education== Clegg holds a BA from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and a PhD from the University of Michigan. ==Works== Clegg has written several books, including An Original Man: The Life and Times of Elijah Muhammad, Troubled Ground: A Tale of Murder, Lynching, and Reckoning in the New South, and The Price of Liberty: African Americans and the Making of Liberia. ==Selected bibliography== * An Original Man: The Life and Times of Elijah Muhammad, New York: St. Martin’s Press, 1997.
